author: Tracy L Fortman

review: I love it. My techie friend loves it. Even my technophobe Dad loves it. That pretty much covers it.Sometimes Netflix freezes, so I power cycle and unplug/replug. That has solved the problem so far. Otherwise it's my prefered method for tv watching on an actual tv. How novel. We were using plex before, then tried to upgrade machines, and it was a horrible mess. Screen sharing stopped working. The new drives were iffy. Plex would not recognize the directory and you can't just play a file in it like you would VLC. Mac's are on their way out and Plex is crap, so use this instead and let the cloud take over our lives.

review: I give this two stars due to the extremely limited content offerings.  No Netflix, cannot stream from your phone, no USB or sd slot.  I don't even use it.  I bought a Roku 3 and it is on a totally different level.  The Roku has seemingly endless variety of content and does all the things this thing doesn't.  I don't recommend this unless you just want to watch YouTube on your TV.
